Evolutionary game of banks and enterprises in digital supply chain finance driven by blockchain
Evolutionary game of banks and enterprises in digital supply chain
finance driven by blockchain
Guoqing Zhao2,3, Jianmei Dong2, Mohan Liu2, Kun Zhai1,2
1. Institute of Finance, University of Jinan, Jinan 250002, PR China
2. School of Finance, Shandong University of Finance and Economics, Jinan 250014, PR China
3. Shandong Key Laboratory of Blockchain Finance, Jinan 250014, PR China
E-mail: sm zhaik@ujn.edu.cn
Abstract: In order to explore the influence of blockchain technology on supply chain financing, this article builds an
evolutionary game model of banks and enterprises, which is associated with traditional supply chain finance financing
and digital supply chain finance based on blockchain technology, besides, the article also analyzes the evolutionary path
of subject behavior in different situations. Our research shows that, both of the two evolutionary game models have three
stable evolutionary states. Through simulation, we find that under the guarantee of blockchain technology, the role of
punishment mechanism and credit incentive can be better played in supply chain financing, and the supply chain ecology
will be more optimized.
Key Words: Blockchain, Supply chain financing, Evolutionary game
1 INTRODUCTION
Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) play a vital
role in the development of national economy, the emerging
SME sector is a key driver of sustainable economic growth,
job creation, entrepreneurial activity and innovation, but it-
s development has been restricted by difficult and expen-
sive financing for a long time. The lack of transparency in
SME information and the difficulties banks face in assess-
ing their enterprise capabilities are identified as the main
reasons why SMEs face barriers to bank financing. Due
to the short of transparent financial information, SMEs are
more vulnerable to financing constraints in the credit mar-
ket. At the same time, banks have a high cost of collecting
information about SMEs, so they have a natural disadvan-
tage in providing financing services for SMEs. Although
our country has carried out many reforms to the banking
industry and introduced relevant policies to support these
enterprises, the problems arising from hard and expensive
financing still trouble these SMEs and constrict their eco-
nomic development. In the background of the global spread
of COVID-19, the cash flow pressure of SMEs is becoming
more severe, and the urgency and necessity of cracking the
financing constraints of SMEs are further highlighted.
In this context, it is undoubtedly of great significance to s-
tudy how to alleviate the financing constraints of SMEs to
promote the healthy development of economy. In recent
years, the emergence of supply chain finance has brought
a solution to SMEs in the supply chain, through a secured

credit model based on real trade, core enterprises in the
supply chain guarantee for their partners and SMEs can ob-
tain loans from financial institutions or fintech companies
However, even if there are core enterprises to guarantee,
there are still problems such as false information, high cost
and risk of loan fraud.
As the supply chain is often composed of multi-level struc-
ture, long-tailed enterprises have information barriers and
information islands, and data transmission is often not s-
mooth. The offline investigation process of banks is com-
plicated with low efficiency and high cost, making it diffi-
cult to guarantee the security of supply chain finance.
The application of blockchain technology could theoreti-
cally reduce the risks faced by supply chain finance cur-
rently. The academic community believes that the combi-
nation of blockchain technology and supply chain finance
can increase enterprises trust, avoid potential loan fraud
risks, prevent default risks, reduce cooperation costs, and
improve performance efficiency because of its immutabil-
ity, decentralization, information transparency and other
characteristics. Digital supply chain financial innovation
based on blockchain technology has positive significance
for improving the financial support efficiency of SMEs in
the supply chain, improving the competitiveness and secu-
rity of the industrial chain and supply chain, and supporting
the construction of a new development pattern of double
cycle.
Based on the realistic hypothesis of bounded rationality,
this paper constructs an evolutionary game model of inven-
tory mortgage financing from banks by enterprises located
in the supply chain network by using the evolutionary game
method, and systematically analyzes the behavior evolution
of all subjects of traditional supply chain finance and digital

2 Literature Review
Inventory pledge financing is a financing service provided
by banks for SMEs, many scholars have conducted many
studies on pledge rate and profit distribution. Zhou et al.
[1] considered the decision optimization of pledge rate un-
der the condition of uncertain price and demand of pledge.
Pan and Ni [2] considered the influence of attrition rate, in-
centive factors and other factors on pledge rate and bank
profit. Wang and Lin [3] focused on the principal-agent
relationship between banks and third-party logistics under
the inventory pledge mode, included the asymmetry of fair-
ness preference and capability information of third-party
logistics as important factors in the design of the principal-
supervision contract mechanism, and explored the influ-
ence of the two on the decision-making behavior and ef-
fectiveness of banks and third-party logistics. The above
scholars discussed on the premise that the subject is com-
pletely rational, but the process of inventory pledge financ-
ing is susceptible to a variety of factors, as a result, Tian
et al. [4] established a tripartite evolutionary game model
among banks, logistics enterprises and SMEs based on the
theory of evolutionary game from the perspective of sub-
ject limited rationality, and turned out that the dual incen-
tive mechanism combining reputation value and honesty
reward can prevent the moral hazard of SMEs effectively
and promote them to take honest management decisions.
With the rapid development of blockchain technology,
there are more and more application scenarios, especially
in supply chain finance (Wang et al. [5], Dong et al. [6]).
Due to its natural advantages of supervision, blockchain
can realize information sharing among enterprises on the
chain, and many scholars have discussed the application of
blockchain in pledge financing. Wang et al. [7] conclud-
ed that blockchain technology can improve the traceabili-
ty, transparency and security of supply chain finance busi-
ness and ensure the stable progress of financing process.
Caniato et al. [8] emphasized the role of blockchain and
other technologies in improving supply chain information
sharing so that SMEs can obtain bank financing. Similarly,
Chod et al. [9] believed that the supply chain finance plat-
form constructed by modern financial technologies such as
blockchain can help SMEs and financial institutions reduce
the risk of asymmetric information. Li et al. [10] ana-
lyzed the influence of pledge rate and initial inventory on
corporate financing stragety after the use of blockchain in
pledge business from a quantitative perspective. The results
showed that enterprises with higher initial inventory would
benefit more from blockchain and banks could improve
pledge rate to attract customers. Some scholars also ana-
lyzed the combination of blockchain technology and other
technologies. Yang [11] analyzed the innovative mode of
inventory pledge financing based on blockchain technolo-
gy, and in order to overcome the moral hazard of artificial
fraud in this mode before the data enters the blockchain,
he proposed a combination of blockchain and Internet of
Things technology to ensure that data is open, transparent,
hard to forge and real-time.
3 Evolutionary Game of traditional supply chain
finance between banks and enterprises
3.1 Problem introduction and model design
There are two main bodies in the supply chain inventory
mortgage financing game model, one is SMEs, the other
is commercial banks. The two sides make the following
decisions: according to the principle of maximizing prof-
its, SMEs with loans choose strategic actions: real mort-
gage (providing real and sufficient collateral) or fraudulent
mortgage (such as falsely reporting, concealing the value
of collateral or betting more than one cargo). Commercial
banks can choose to approve the loan or reject the loan.
The loan amount is unitalized into 1, and the banks require
the loan enterprises to provide the collateral whose value is
M (M >1) based on the loan risk consideration. If the en-
terprises choose fraudulent mortgage, the real value of the
collateral goods provided by the enterprises is only m.
Without losing generality, the following assumptions and
explanations are made for SMEs and commercial banks.
(1) If the loan enterprises choose real mortgage, they will
fulfill the contract repayment on schedule after complet-
ing production and business activities. If these enterprises
choose fraudulent mortgage, that is, to defraud the loan for
the purpose, the loan funds will not be put into production
and operation, and they do not have repayment intention,
the collateral is then put at the disposal of the banks.
(2) Assume that the probability of fraudulent mortgage of
SMEs is x1, the probability of true mortgage is 1− x1, the
probability of loan rejection by banks is y, and the proba-
bility of loan approval by banks is 1− y1.
(3) When SMEs choose fraudulent mortgage and the banks
approve the loan, the profit of SMEs is equal to the profit of
reinvestment of loan amount b, minus the collateral value
m, cover cost c, credit loss s, penalty F and the cost of
seeking financing E, so it can be expressed as b−m− c−
s − F − E. The profit of banks include the capital cost of
the loan r and the audit cost MC should be deducted, so
it can be expressed as m − r − MC + F . When banks
refuse to approve loans, the profits of SMEs and banks can
be expressed as −c− E and −MC respectively.
(4) When the SMEs choose real mortgage and banks ap-
prove the loan, the enterprises use the loan funds for rein-
vestment activities to obtain the profit π, repay the entire
amount of principal and interest R to the banks, and pay the
cost of seeking financing e to obtain the incentive of keep-
ing faith l, so the profits of SMEs and banks are π−R+l−e
and R− r−MC respectively. When the SMEs choose re-
al mortgage but the banks reject the loan, the enterprises
pay the seeking financing cost e, and the profit of banks is
−MC.
To sum up, the payoff matrix of the evolutionary game be-
tween SMEs and banks is shown in Table 1.

3.3 Numerical simulation analysis
In this part, fraudulent mortgage penalty F , credit loss s,
and profit of keeping faith l are selected as variables to an-
alyze the evolution process of the game result. Set initial
parameter values: m=0.5, l=0.1, R=1.037,π=1.2, r=1.015,
s=0.07, c=0.25, F=0.2, b=1.15, E=0.03, e=0.04, where the
bank capital cost r selects the one-year deposit interest rate
implemented by the bank. According to the principle that
the inventory pledge rate shall not exceed 70%, M = 1.5
is taken, and the loan interest rate R refers to the one-year
bank loan interest rate of the central bank. On the basis
of the initial value, the values of other parameters are set
unchanged. The initial probability (x0, y0) =(0.4,0.5), let
F=0.2, 0.4, 0.6, respectively; l=0.1, 0.3, 0.5, respective-
ly; s=0.10, 0.20, 0.30, respectively. Simulation results are
shown in Figure 2 (a)-(c).
The introduction of punishment mechanism can improve
the incentive effect of loss on both sides of the game and
contribute to the good development of cooperation. The
punishment mechanism of this paper is reflected in the con-
struction of default penalty F and default credit loss s. By
constructing default penalty and credit loss, SMEs not on-
ly need to pay certain penalty after default, but also suffer

credit loss more importantly. Figure 2 show that both de-
fault penalty and credit loss will affect the strategic choices
of commercial banks and SMEs. With the increase of de-
fault penalty F , the evolution from commercial banks to
the stable point of approved loans and from SMEs to the
stable point of real mortgage will accelerate.
The impact of default penalty and on-chain default credit
loss on SMEs is similar. SMEs cheat loans from financial
institutions in order to obtain better earnings, the existence
of default penalty reduces their earnings, and even when
the default penalty is too much, SMEs profit exceeds its ex-
penditure. In order to avoid unnecessary losses, SMEs tend
to take real mortgage, and the existence of default penalty
has a certain incentive effect on these enterprises to keep
the contract. At the same time, once SMEs engage in loan
fraud by fraudulent mortgage, for the next event, commer-
cial banks or other financial institutions may raise interest
rates or refuse financing requests due to their history of de-
fault, so the rise of credit losses can force SMEs to make
real mortgage.
It can be seen from Figure 2 that the bigger the credit in-
centive is in real mortgage, the greater the probability of
real mortgage is for SMEs. Through incentives, small and
medium- sized enterprises are more willing to make real
mortgage, so as to build a supply chain financial ecosystem
and let more financing demands participate in it.
4 Evolutionary game of supply chain finance
driven by blockchain
4.1 Problem introduction and model design
Blockchain technology is conducive to the financing of
SMEs, especially in supply chain financing. Under the
guarantee of blockchain technology, core enterprises can
more effectively manage group resources, are more will-
ing to provide credit guarantee for supply chain financ-
ing, banks can also effectively reduce fraudulent mortgage
loans, SMEs can reduce financing costs, and the supply
chain ecology is more optimized. Based on the model in
part 3, this part introduces the application of blockchain
technology, modifies the relevant parameters, and con-
structs a new evolutionary game model. After docking with
the blockchain platform, if SMEs want to cheat the mort-
gage, they need to tamper with the collateral information
before the information is recorded in the blockchain. At the
same time, because all the inventory information in the sup-
ply chain is recorded in the blockchain (it can be recorded
in the blockchain through non manual and machine collec-
tion information), it can pass the cross verification of the
accounting node of the supply chain, The fraud of lend-
ing enterprises will be easy to be found, and the cover up
cost of enterprises will increase exponentially. After the
application of blockchain, the cost of concealment is much
greater than that before the application of blockchain. It is
assumed that the cost of concealment of loan enterprises is
nc.
Commercial banks review loan enterprises through the in-
formation on the blockchain. To simplify the analysis, it
is assumed that the cost of blockchain connection between
enterprises and banks is D. After going up the chain, the
information of breach of contract and compliance will be
broadcast and disclosed, and the dissemination scope of
enterprise information will be expanded. Therefore, the
incentive of enterprise trustworthiness will increase to L
(L > l), and the credit loss will increase to S (S > s).
To sum up, the evolutionary game benefit matrix of SMEs
and banks under the application of blockchain is shown in
Table 3.

4.3 Numerical example simulation
We use numerical simulation to compare the differences
between traditional supply chain finance and supply chain
finance after the application of blockchain. Set initial pa-
rameters m = 0.5, l = 0.1, L = 0.2, R = 1.037, π = 1.2, r
= 1.015, s = 0.07, S = 0.1, c=0.25, F=0.2, b=1.15, E=0.1,
e=0.04, nc=1.25.
First of all, from the perspective of covering up costs, af-
ter the application of blockchain, the covering up cost-
s of small and medium-sized enterprises rise, small and
medium-sized enterprises are more inclined to real mort-
gage loans, and commercial banks are easier to provide
loans. This is because the inventory key node information
of SMEs will be recorded on the blockchain. Based on the
traceability and non tamperability of blockchain, through
the cross verification of key information, the fraud of lend-
ing enterprises will be more easily found, and the cost of
concealment is very high. In other words, after the appli-
cation of blockchain technology, due to the high cost of
forging information, SMEs tend to real mortgage, which is
ultimately conducive to alleviating the financing difficulties
of SMEs and maximizing the benefits of banks.
Secondly, it can be seen from Figure 3 that after the appli-
cation of blockchain technology, once a small and medium-
sized enterprise defaults, it will be broadcast by the whole
network, and the default credit loss will increase. SMEs
tend to real mortgage, and it is easier for banks and enter-
prises to reach a cooperation strategy. Because after the
completion of each transaction, the bank will record the re-
payment of the enterprise on the blockchain, which makes
the enterprise more unwilling or afraid to default after ob-
taining financing. If the enterprise defaults, the enterprise
will pay huge reputation costs. Therefore, compared with
the traditional bank financing model, the default probabili-
ty of SMEs will decrease significantly.
In the supply chain financing under the application of
blockchain technology, the credit incentives (such as to-
kens or credit points) that enterprises keep their promises
will be obtained. The whole inventory loan process of en-
terprises is recorded on the blockchain. Due to their good
credit record, trustworthy enterprises can obtain more fi-
nancing opportunities and lower loan interest rate. It can be
seen from Figure 3 that after the application of blockchain,
due to the improvement of credit incentives, Small and
medium-sized enterprises will not choose fraudulent mort-
gage.
5 Conclusions and recommendations
Supply chain finance has brought financing channels to
SMEs in the supply chain and invigorated the capital flow.
However, with the frequent occurrence of thunder events,
the risk degree of swindling loans and running away with
money has been controversial. Financing platform based
on blockchain arises at the historic moment, but there is
still no large-scale popularization, so this article first es-
tablishes the traditional evolutionary game model of sup-
ply chain finance, explores the existing problems and ana-
lyzes the evolutionary process of the market, furthermore,
it modifies the model of supply chain finance combined
with blockchain technology, compares the changes of equi-
librium decision, and finally the relevant conclusions are

Authorized licensed use limited to: CITY UNIV OF HONG KONG. Downloaded on April 15,2023 at 08:46:33 UTC from IEEE Xplore.  Restrictions apply. 
verified intuitively by numerical simulation. Through the
above research, the following conclusions are drawn.
It is very important for banks to punish SMEs for breach of
contract and encourage them to abide by the contract. On
the one hand, it can deter SMEs, on the other hand, it can
guide them to abide by the contract for repayment and pre-
vent the interests of banks from being damaged. Core en-
terprises can attract SMEs to participate through incentive
measures to achieve mutual benefit and win-win between
commercial banks, core enterprises, ownership enterpris-
es and SMEs (cooperative merchants). At the same time,
they can use the innovative characteristics of blockchain
to expand the dissemination scope of enterprise dishonesty
information and increase the cost of dishonesty and breach
of contract.
Combined with blockchain technology, supply chain fi-
nance can reduce the cost of seeking capital and bank audit.
Comparing the evolution process of the two cooperation
models, after applying the blockchain technology platfor-
m, it will be easier and faster for multiple parties to reach
a cooperative relationship, that is, the bank approves the
loan, the core enterprise increases the credit, and the real
mortgage of SMEs, so as to realize the mutual benefit and
win-win between banks and enterprises. The application
of blockchain improves the incentive of keeping promise
and the loss of default credit, and makes the evolution tend
to be stable faster, that is, blockchain technology helps to
form a good supply chain financial ecology.
